required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neoadjuvant SHR-1210 Plus Apatinib for Resectable Stage III-IV Acral Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-cencer,Phase II Study of Neoadjuvant SHR-1210 Plus Apatinib for Resectable Stage III-IV Acral Melanoma
clinical_study.source: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: Acral melanoma is a melanoma that affects acral areas of the skin, which is the most prevalent site of melanoma in non-Caucasians.Data in this subgroup is scarce.This study is to evalueate the efficiency and safety of Neoadjuvant SHR-1210 plus apatinib in this particular group,menawhile to determine the predictive value for efficiency of several biomarkers.

detailed_description.textblock: SHR-1210 is a humanized monoclonal antibody against Programmed death 1(PD-1). Apatinib is a new kind of selective Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Receptor 2(VEGFR-2) tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI).

intervention.description: Drug: SHR-1210 SHR-1210 will be administered as a 30-minute IV infusion Q2W at a dose of 200mg Drug: Apatinib Apatinib tablet will be administered orally,once daily until progression

facility.name: The first hospital of Jilin University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
